content: It seems like we are talking about having a meeting to define forge vs rustc-dev-guide (probably 1h), a meeting to start organizing better the guide (probably 1h) and a meeting to tackle issues (also probably 1h)
I wonder what should we do :)
first of all I'd cancel the sync meeting we have of 30 minutes and allocate 1h there and use that time for one of those meetings
then possibly I'd have another 1h meeting next week but I'd defer the third one for the other week
@mark-i-m thoughts?
That seems reasonable
so ... we didn't coordinate properly this yet
I propose to do the following and let me know if it works ...
tomorrow tuesday 12th from 7.30pm UTC to 8.30pm (forge vs rustc-dev-guide)
thursday 14th from 6.30pm UTC to 7.30pm (structure of the guide)
tuesday 19th from 7.30pm URC to 8.30pm (work on issues/prs)
sorry, have changed the order
we could also start with issues
but I think it's better to do forge vs rustc-dev-guide before the structure of the guide

Santiago Pastorino said:

but I think it's better to do forge vs rustc-dev-guide before the structure of the guide

do we need an hour for that conversation?
ahh sorry, so yeah, I told Mark to do this synced with him
I don't think we should all be there
also, I could totally do this by myself :)
I just want to schedule for myself one full hour to work on each of these topics
So, meeting tomorrow canceled for the rest of the group?
yes, if everyone agree on this, let's do the proposed meetings
@WG-rustc-dev-guide how the proposed schedule work for you all?
am kool with those, though I generally would rather have a weekly 30m meeting
... rest can be async

Santiago Pastorino said:

ahh sorry, so yeah, I told Mark to do this synced with him

Oh... Did I forget to do something? Did I misunderstand?
I can meet tomorrow and the following Tuesday, but I can only do 30 minutes on Thursday at that time.
Sorry! For the late responses!

mark-i-m said:

Santiago Pastorino said:

ahh sorry, so yeah, I told Mark to do this synced with him

Oh... Did I forget to do something? Did I misunderstand?

I don't think so, the idea would be to define what to do with forge and rustc-dev-guide and propose something

mark-i-m said:

I can meet tomorrow and the following Tuesday, but I can only do 30 minutes on Thursday at that time.

are you able if we do it a bit earlier or later?
maybe same time works? thursday also 7.30pm UTC to 8.30pm UTC?

I don't think so, the idea would be to define what to do with forge and rustc-dev-guide and propose something

Do you mean before the meeting or in the meeting?
I could do 6pm UTC Thursday or after 9pm UTC, but I guess the latter would be pretty late for most of the others
Btw, if we do prepare a proposal before hand or async, I don't think we will need a 1 hour meeting
ok, so I think I'd need 1 full hour to prepare a proposal and I wanted to schedule that time for myself but I wouldn't mind if someone else joins me
maybe is better if I use a full hour and prepare something and then we sync?
in that case, why don't we do the issues meeting today and not have the one on thursday
so we could do today 6.30pm UTC issues and next tuesday 6.30pm UTC structure of the guide, maybe?
as @mark-i-m noted I meant, 7.30pm UTC
@WG-rustc-dev-guide we would be going over forge and rustc-dev-guide for 1h with @mark-i-m if someone else want to join we will be going this on a zulip topic in 12 minutes
Sure, let's discuss in this topic: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/196385-t-compiler.2Fwg-rustc-dev-guide/topic/forge.20vs.20rustc-dev-guide
now that we had this meeting that was like 2 meetings at once
we would need to just schedule for issues

Santiago Pastorino said:

tuesday 19th from 7.30pm URC to 8.30pm (work on issues/prs)

I'd go with this :point_up:
@WG-rustc-dev-guide

Santiago Pastorino said:

Santiago Pastorino said:

tuesday 19th from 7.30pm URC to 8.30pm (work on issues/prs)

I'd go with this :point_up:

ok, I've scheduled on the compiler team calendar this meeting for next tuesday 19th 7.30pm UTC
@WG-rustc-dev-guide ^^^
